Detailed Description

  • Treat buffer as an I/O stream.

(c) 1998-2007 (W3C) MIT, ERCIM, Keio University See tidy.h for the copyright notice.

CVS Info :

Author
arnaud02
Date
2007/01/23 11:17:45
Revision
1.9

Requires buffer to automatically grow as bytes are added. Must keep track of current read and write points.

Bool TIDY_CALL tidyBufCheckAlloc ( TidyBuffer *  buf,
uint  allocSize,
uint  chunkSize 
)

Expand buffer to given size. Chunk size is minimum growth. Pass 0 for default of 256 bytes.

Return the number of bytes readable from the buffer.

int TIDY_CALL tidyBufPeekLastByte ( TidyBuffer *  buf  ) 

Get byte from end of buffer. Does NOT modify input offset.

int TIDY_CALL tidyBufPeekByte ( TidyBuffer *  buf  ) 

Get byte from front of buffer. Does NOT modify input offset.

size_t TIDY_CALL tidyBufGetString ( TidyBuffer *  buf,
tmbstr  dst,
size_t  dstsize 
)

Get a string from the front of the buffer. The input offset will be incremented.

Parameters:
dst must point to a valid buffer of size dstsize (or larger)
dstsize specifies the maximum number of bytes which will be copied from buf to dst, minus 1: the C string sentinel '' (NUL)
Returns:
Returns the number of bytes copied to dst, without counting the NUL sentinel.
